description: A great and capable game engine

For someone getting started in game development this is a life saver.

Getting my Steam Deck set up as a development environment was surprisingly easy!
An awesome open source engine, which does not treat Linux as a second-class citizen, as the main developer runs Linux himself.

Great tool that simplifies the game development process a lot. 

It can be complemented well with open source tools like Tiled and Libresprite
It's kind of funny that Unity only released a Linux port of their editor when they realized that Godot was gaining traction.
summary: Kinda like Unity but it's not closed source garbage

description: i love this engine it does what it says

Great for something open source and similar to Unity. They have really good documentation on their website, and there's a lot of videos on youtube for beginners. I recommend the KidsCanCode intro to 3d youtube series. Those videos are suited for people of all ages.

This is a great engine for solo devs and small teams. It's extremely fast to iterate prototypes and is very intuitive. The only downsides i can see is that you can't export to consoles without you yourself creating the build templates for each specific console, and 3d features and performance is good, but not comparable to Unity and Unreal
summary: Great Engine for solo developers and small teams

description: Godot is simple and easy to understand and master. It excells in 2d game development since in Unity the 2d editor is just the 3d one with the Z-axis flattened which shows just how lazy it's creators are.
summary: Hands down the best game engine for Linux

description: Para mi es el mejor motor de videojuegos
Quickly and easily make games!
I can't even use it. trying to open it will tell me that my drivers aren't up to date. Utter garbage.
I have not really got the hang of it yet, but working on it and learning all the time. Looks like a good system when I learn how to use it, worth learning to to use.
Free and open tools like this with the versatility and accesibility of Godot are a truly rare thing in the games industry and there's no excuse for overlooking this software.
summary: Incredibly important for the games industry

description: It's free! Only dipped a little bit of my small toe in but so far it feels warm and inviting. Definitely going to take a plunge. Will update review after immersion. Did I mention it's free?

This game engine is fantastic!
It consumes almost no resources and is very light!

The guy under me complaining is probably using an old Thinkpad from 2005 because this engine even runs on my 2015 Phone perfectly fine!

This game engine might outcompete Unitys Indie market with their Indie market that grows bigger and bigger because the engine is open-source and completely free and if you guys follow what Unity has become over the recent years you will understand why I switched!

It may be a hassle to get used to the Node system once you switch over from Unity but that hassle will go away faster than you think like all other new or missing stuff.

I personally find that the Tilemap system is way better here and the Input system here is also better than the new Unity Input system that is buggy to the infinity but I must admit that the play mode is much better on Unitys side because you can see in the Unity UI what changes or gets added instead of relying on a console.

Since Godot 4.0 it is a 4.5/5 engine for me personally.
Can't wait how the engine will develope over the time.

I downloaded it and was up and running with one of the demos in the space of a few minutes. 
Already this is better than gameMakerStudio.
is a good engine
great app lovedit I have used it for my university project
summary: great app loved it I have used it for my university project

description:
Very intuitive and also very light so you can run it on garbage computers and still make games

Just try it, it's like a 30mb download
summary: Very good game engine, just try it

description: Wish the Fedora build was more up to date. latest stable is 3.2.3 but the package manager is still on 3.2.1
10/10 interface for 2D
The best game engine in the world
Best Open Source Game Dev Engine
The best Game Engine I know
Really comes into its own in linux (I previously ran it on windows) and succeeds at being by far the best and most intuitive game engine.

Godot Engine is a perfect tool for prototyping purposes, saving significant amount of time needed going from an idea to implementation thanks to GDScript, which is so tightly integrated with the engine internals.

Godot is often compared to Unity, but feature-wise it's not quite the same. If you need to go more advanced, Godot may not always offer a complete solution that could allow to solve specific use cases easier. Things like usability are always preferred over performance, and if there's a doubt whether to make something configurable or not, Godot core developers will likely decide on the latter - "It's too specific", they say.

Due to extremely pragmatic nature of Godot's development process, some features may get overly simplified in the interest of achieving good looking results that don't require spending hours or days to implement compared to other (commercial) engines, and it's a trade-off that Godot core developers deliberately choose to accept, yet this kind of approach may not be clear to existing Godot audience that haven't yet needed more than they currently use in their projects, which may lead to disappointment at some point in the future.

Gladly, the engine has ability to extend its core features via C++ modules and GDNative that allow to alleviate existing limitations yourself. If you plan to use Godot in the long term, be prepared to the possibility that you may need maintain your custom version of the engine, and that requires the knowledge of C++ development.

This review is based on my own experience using the engine and contributing to Godot's development myself for the past 4 years. There's a big gap between what's advertised, expectations, and reality, otherwise I'd certainly give five stars to Godot Engine, no questions asked!
summary: Spectacular, but oftentimes doesn't meet expectations

description: godot is one of best

I went from knowing absolutely nothing about programming and learning GdScript on windows to having a home network of ubuntu computers using a raspberry pi 4 as a server. In 12 months! Godot also made me better looking and food tastes much more vibrant as well!
There are some differences and each has their own strength, but Godot is a great alternative to Unity and is becoming a serious competitor in the game creation market.
Godot is the most stable, modular, and efficient 2D and 3D game engine I've ever used, and it's only getting better with time! Great work Godot team!
Been using it for 3 years and i absolutely love it!
This is rubbish it consumes like 70% of my cpu when it is not even open.

I've been using the Godot Engine for ~5 years, and if quite satisfied with it. Like anything else, there's room for improvements (I'd say this is mainly the case with plugin creation, as it is quite limiting on some aspects). Overall my experience with the Godot has been great, and I highly recommend it. As for the package itself, it has worked very well so far.
summary: I've been using it for ~5 years and I'm satisfied

description: This package does not work "out of the box"; at least not on the KDE version of Fedora 38. The launcher screen appears when running the application, but none of the controls within the window interact in any way. This renders it essentially useless. :( Could be just me...
summary: Not working as a one click install on KDE Fedora 38

description: I find making games in here very simple and making them look polished simple aswell. Also, their own language (GDScript) is very simple to learn it only took me a month to learn it. It's just python but optimised for game development. This engine also unofficially supports other languages too like Lua (not Luau) Python C and C++, all because it's open-sourced.
summary: This game engine is very simple to use

description: its great and all but why is it godot v3.3 and not v4.0 like seriously
summary: ok but why is it godot v3.3 and not v4.0

man kanns zwar manual erstellen aber ziemlich frickel arbeit .....

wäre toll wenn man dann auch die versions nummer angleichen würde .......

GDscript is also really nice
Es un motor muy completo y mi favorito para 2d ademas de ser facil de aprender a usar. gdscript banca.
